Name: Aveiro
Description: Located in central Portugal, known for its coastal cities and scenic lagoon landscapes.

Name: Beja
Description: Situated in the southern part of the country, famous for its rural landscape and agricultural richness.

Name: Braga
Description: Known for its historic significance, religious sites, and as a hub for tourism in northern Portugal.

Name: Bragança
Description: A northern region, known for its mountainous landscapes and medieval history.

Name: Castelo Branco
Description: A region in central Portugal, known for its historical towns and beautiful countryside.

Name: Coimbra
Description: Famous for its prestigious university and historical architecture.

Name: Évora
Description: A city and region in the Alentejo known for its well-preserved Roman and medieval landmarks.

Name: Faro
Description: Located in the Algarve, known for its stunning beaches, vibrant nightlife, and cultural sites.

Name: Guarda
Description: A mountainous region known for its natural parks, traditional villages, and historic landmarks.

Name: Leiria
Description: Known for its historic towns, castles, and proximity to the Atlantic coast.

Name: Lisbon
Description: The capital city and its surrounding region, known for its cultural richness, nightlife, and historic sites.

Name: Madeira
Description: An archipelago off the northwest coast of Africa, famous for its subtropical climate and beautiful landscapes.

Name: Montijo
Description: A city and municipality near Lisbon, known for its proximity to the river Tagus and a mix of urban and rural life.

Name: Portalegre
Description: A region in the Alentejo known for its rolling hills, olive groves, and traditional villages.

Name: Porto
Description: The second-largest city in Portugal, famous for its wine production and stunning riverside landscapes.

Name: Santarem
Description: A central region, known for its agricultural heritage and historical towns.

Name: Setubal
Description: Located on the Atlantic coast, famous for its seafood and the nearby Arrábida Natural Park.

Name: Viana do Castelo
Description: A northern region with stunning coastal views and a rich maritime history.

Name: Vila Real
Description: A mountainous region in northern Portugal, known for its vineyards and scenic beauty.

Name: Viseu
Description: Known for its historic old town and surrounding vineyards in the Dão wine region.
